ie11 is an exception

fixes #11753

issue.title: In Webpack 5 a target containing IE 11 doesn't build the runtime in ES5

repository.name: webpack
repository.description: A bundler for javascript and friends. Packs many modules into a few bundled assets. Code Splitting allows for loading parts of the application on demand. Through "loaders", modules can be CommonJs, AMD, ES6 modules, CSS, Images, JSON, Coffeescript, LESS, ... and your custom stuff.

issue.body:
<!-- Please don't delete this template because we'll close your issue -->
<!-- Before creating an issue please make sure you are using the latest version of webpack. -->

# Bug report

<!-- Please ask questions on StackOverflow or the webpack Gitter. -->
<!-- https://stackoverflow.com/questions/ask?tags=webpack -->
<!-- https://gitter.im/webpack/webpack -->
<!-- Issues which contain questions or support requests will be closed. -->

**What is the current behavior?**

In Webpack 5 a [`target`](https://webpack.js.org/configuration/target/) containing Internet Explorer 11, e.g. `target: 'browserslist:ie 11',`, doesn't build the runtime in ES5.

**If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce.**

1. Have a target which includes IE 11, e.g. `target: 'browserslist:ie 11'`
2. Run webpack
3. Try to load your application in IE 11
4. See errors in the console, e.g.
   [SCRIPT1010](https://docs.microsoft.com/de-de/scripting/javascript/misc/expected-identifier-javascript): Expected identifier
    ```
   /******/ 		// install a JSONP callback for chunk loading
   /******/ 		var webpackJsonpCallback = function(data) {
   /******/ 			var [chunkIds, moreModules, runtime, executeModules] = data; // <- this line
   ```

<!-- A great way to do this is to provide your configuration via a GitHub repository -->
<!-- The most helpful is a minimal reproduction with instructions on how to reproduce -->
<!-- Repositories with too many files or large `webpack.config.js` files are not suitable -->
<!-- Please only add small code snippets directly into this issue -->
<!-- https://gist.github.com is a good place for longer code snippets -->
<!-- If your issue is caused by a plugin or loader, please create an issue on the loader/plugin repository instead -->

**What is the expected behavior?**

Runtime is ES5 if IE 11 is present, like `target: ['web', 'es5']` mentioned in https://webpack.js.org/migrate/5/#turn-off-es2015-syntax-in-runtime-code-if-necessary.

<!-- "It should work" is not a helpful explanation -->
<!-- Explain exactly how it should behave -->

**Other relevant information:**
webpack version: 5.3.2
Node.js version: 14.7.0
Operating System: Win10 2004
Additional tools: Powershell

Related to #11814 or #11753 maybe?

The SCRIPT1010 error above exist when running `mode: 'development',`, in `mode: 'production',` I get [SCRIPT1003](https://docs.microsoft.com/de-de/scripting/javascript/misc/expected-colon): Expected ':' in one of our bundles, so it's probably not even limited to the runtime?

As hinted, using `target: ['web', 'es5']` works fine in both cases. `'browserslist:IE >= 10'` like in #11753 works as well. But both these workarounds aren't the same as targeting IE 11.

body: @evilebottnawi can we re-open this? I am running into the same problem on `webpack@5.5.0`, if I change `browserslist` to `not ie < 10`, it works, but if it's at `not ie < 11` I still get arrow functions in my bundle.
@sethomas double check your webpack version, I can't reopen issue without reproducible steps, sorry
@evilebottnawi Odd, I'll chalk it up to me having to deal with IE 11 that threw me off, all is well, sorry for wrong information and thanks for the response.

issue.title: single-spa app doesn't load on IE (Windows 10)
issue.body:
Hi Team,

I am facing an issue when accessing the application built on single-spa on Internet Explorer (Windows 10). Initially I got issue with Promise. I then added the CDN ployfill for Promise and URL. But ended up in syntax error pointing the root-config.

 <script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/bluebird/3.4.3/bluebird.min.js"></script>
  <script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/url-polyfill@1.1.10/url-polyfill.min.js"></script>

I tried running the https://github.com/react-microfrontends on local and found the same issue. It works on chrome, edge.
![ie-version](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24412069/108824534-d6688000-75e7-11eb-9fd4-90a24361ab04.jpg)


Could you please help in resolving this issue?

body:
I'm still running into this problem, but only with our production build in a docker image. My local development build works fine.
I'm not sure how to properly reproduce it.

My webpack version is 5.21.2
The docker image is node:14.15-alpine with very little added and the exact node version is 14.15.4
I have a .browserslistrc file with "defaults"
Also happens with the latest webpack version (5.24.2) but at least the workaround suggested by @amok fixes it for me

issue.title: Build for ie11 again
issue.body:
Fixes #12179

Seems like a bug in webpack, see https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/11753
